p: A total of 72 seven-day-old female Ross 308 chicks were used. The birds were weighed and randomly distributed into 3 different groups. A total of 12 replicates per treatment were used with 2 birds per replicate. The birds were kept in metabolic cages until they reached 30 days of age. The housing conditions were in accordance with the Aviagen recommendations. The temperature was maintained at 27 °C until day 7 and was gradually reduced to 21 °C by day 21; thereafter, it was kept constant. The lighting cycles (hours of light/hours of dark) were 19:5 from day 7 to 21 and 23:1 from day 22 to 30.
